title: Why do tanky champs deal damage??? Lets see, pick a champ
body: Name a tanky champ that deals damage. Lets see how strong they really are and where

replies.body: {{champion:111}}

his damage isn't that good, he just doesn't take much of yours unless you can burst through his shield. He does average damage and does so in windows. If I'm not mistaken though you can prevent this damage by bursting his shield down.

Also he is strong early, he falls off later if you don't feed. He can't push for shit unless he goes ap in which case he still wont scale well and pushing wont be a good idea for him. He can take towers I think since he scales well with attack speed but then I don't think he takes towers down fast.
{{champion:32}}

his stun is strong and he is very tanky, he also gets rewarded for tanking damage and kindof counters attack speed. Deals passive %hp magic damage and he can stop autoattacking for a moment which means a drop in sustain. 

Has nothing to help him take any towers or anything though. 

Currently he has an advantage earlygame because of how he can take down the wraiths which makes him one of the few strong tank junglers. In otherwords he's probably leveling faster than normal not actually just being strong but snowballing exists. But this can be countered with invades and harass cant it? He doesn't travel quickly which means stealing from him should be that much easier

Base damages are a thing. If they had no base damages, they would not be able to fight non-tanks in toplane/jungle. Take 100, deal 40. Even with more HP, you lose over time when they keep doing it.

True but then you have to consider, why are squishies always necessarily if there are champs like this. 

Tanks... "tanks"... are supposed to be stronger earlygame and may snowball later, this is actually how its designed. They have better base stats that fall off over time due to outscaling, or is there a champ that doesn't do this?

Their base damages are less effective when the enemy is building health and a relevant resistance.
The prevelance of CDR has made some of them able to more easily pull off ability cycles to get their base damages off more often.
It's not able that squishies don't often build health or resistances, so those rank 5 abilities' base damages are significant.


Squishies are needed because they are better are bursting down other squishies, and objectives, and often have an advantage of range.

One could also say this

tanky champs need to be that strong because squishies are broken.

Are you just theory crafting how they're not dealing good damage or are you checking statistics on op.gg or such?

Theory in ones' mind can say:
Soraka sucks at healing because she's squishy, thus she can spend the entire game dead against diving champs.

Statistics from real games can show different story though, and is usually more accurate since it's over a large quantity of games.
http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.totalHeal&order=descend&roleSort=Support

In any case, I've seen a lot of successful AP naut tops lately.  I don't see them as often as dairy, but they're out there! :D

To say i'm doing either would be an exaggeration. Lets just say we haven't gotten that far with any specific champ yet. Soraka can deal some damage but its very limited and she has no particularly hard cc. If she cant burst you then she is going to suffer unless she has a peeler. 

Does she suck at healing? doubt it, but I believe it comes at a cost. A diver would be very strong against her but the catch is you cant rely on your abilities and you might not escape as supports counter assassins and assassinlike champs just because of their nature. But offensively soraka is very limited and she can't push well. 

Soraka has nothing whatsoever to make her a strong tower or objective taker but she could help immensely if someone else wants to do it.. fitting seeing as she's a support and all. AD soraka isn't much better

this one is hardly tanky, but he can build into it. This one is more of a damage evader which is ultimately countered with cc. He can escape but he gets nothing done when he does escape. This is something I abused in my last match. He also cant push well and be tanky at the same time unless he uses a terrible build.

{{champion:14}} 

The answer may surprise you.

has a massive hp chunk on his shield forcing you to fight or run

2 slows and has a knock up but its shitty and slow and does like no damage. 

His e is annoying and his ult lets him get past his lack of mobility for a moment. 

He has no targeted abilities, actually all of  them push lanes and yet he is a terrible lane pusher. I imagine he's a great pick against people who don't know how to control a minion wave which is like 75% of the community so don't get the wrong idea. 

Against a reasonable not bad player he probably gets like an hp items worth of free hp every match from passive if he still has that. 

If you kill him he gets stronger for a bit and may kill you back. 

He doesn't appear to have anything for taking towers down faster except his passive which is costly for the most part. 

what else has he got?
